content: cut end through both inside hind leg sts pull up to gather and secure the end body seams all of the following body seams are joined with ws together working mattress stitch as follows join inside hind legs to belly fig 9 ref fig 9 1 begin by matching the fastened-off inside leg sts to the rear end marker and hold in place with a stitch or two before joining the inside hind legs to belly as follows ref fig 10 join seam as dotted lines show 2 working on one side of the belly/ hind legs at a time match the hind leg front marker to the belly to hind leg front marker and join the seam to connect the inner hind leg cast-on edge to the belly row ends from the rear end marker to the hind leg front/ belly to hind leg front markers remove belly to hind leg front and rear end markers note just a reminder - the hind leg seams should be at the back of the hind legs fig 10 sloth page 18 sloth page 19 add eyes ref fig 12 push the eyes in place and either glue in place sew in place or fasten the washers onto the eye backs fig 12 fig 11 join inside neck to neck ref fig 11 join white dotted lines together for left side of neck and fig 13 black dotted lines together for right side of neck working on one side at a time match the neck marker to the neck to join belly to back inner foreleg marker and join the seam from the head to back seam ref fig 13 to the neck/ neck to inner foreleg markers - the two edges are different working on one side at a time match the belly to inner foreleg to the foreleg lengths so you ll need to ease the seams together marker and join the short seam joining back row ends to belly row ends remove neck to inner foreleg markers from the belly to inner foreleg/ foreleg markers to the hind leg front marker remove hind leg front markers and foreleg markers sloth page 20 sloth page 21 you now have two seams to sew before completely closing the body so wire armature at this stage you will stuff the head and body continue joining the remaining ref figs 16 17 18 19 & 20 seams or if you want to add an armature see pages 21 & 22 before joining a bend a single 30cm/ 12in wire as shown below the following inner foreleg to belly seams b then bend a second single wire around the first wire where the forelegs join belly to inner foreleg seams are to go as shown below ref figs 14 & 15 c bind yarn a around the wires especially around the bent edges to stop working on one side of the body at a time join all along the side of the body them
